hints_html: Recall that dot products and cross products can be written in terms of angles between vectors. Which one of those two products (dot or cross) uses cosine?
hints_latex:
Recall that dot products and cross products can be written in terms of
angles between vectors. Which one of those two products (dot or cross)
uses cosine?
hints_raw: Recall that dot products and cross products can be written in terms of angles between vectors.  Which one of those two products (dot or cross) uses cosine?
question: A 08
sols_html:
We can write the dot product between two vectors u and v as

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbf{u}\cdot\mathbf{v}=|\mathbf{u}||\mathbf{v}|\cos(\theta)\end{aligned}\]

where \(\theta\) is the angle between vectors u and v. Therefore we have that

\[\begin{aligned} \cos(\theta)=\frac{\mathbf{u}\cdot\mathbf{v}}{|\mathbf{u}||\mathbf{v}|}.\end{aligned}\]

Here our two vectors are

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbf{u}&=[1,2,3]\\ \mathbf{v}&=[-1,5,-2]\end{aligned}\]

We have that

\[\begin{aligned} |\mathbf{u}|&=\sqrt{1+4+9}=\sqrt{14}\\ |\mathbf{v}|&=\sqrt{1+25+4}=\sqrt{30}\end{aligned}\]

and that

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbf{u}\cdot\mathbf{v}=u_1v_1+u_2v_2+u_3v_3=-1+10-6=3.\end{aligned}\]

Therefore,

\[\begin{aligned} \cos(\theta)=\frac{3}{\sqrt{14}\sqrt{30}}=\frac{3}{\sqrt{420}}.\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
We can write the dot product between two vectors '''u''' and '''v''' as

:<math>
\mathbf{u}\cdot\mathbf{v}=|\mathbf{u}||\mathbf{v}|\cos(\theta)
</math>

where <math>\theta</math> is the angle between vectors '''u''' and '''v'''.  Therefore we have that

:<math>
\cos(\theta)=\frac{\mathbf{u}\cdot\mathbf{v}}{|\mathbf{u}||\mathbf{v}|}.
</math>

Here our two vectors are

:<math>
\begin{align}
\mathbf{u}&=[1,2,3]\\
\mathbf{v}&=[-1,5,-2]
\end{align}.
</math>

We have that

:<math>
\begin{align}
|\mathbf{u}|&=\sqrt{1+4+9}=\sqrt{14}\\
|\mathbf{v}|&=\sqrt{1+25+4}=\sqrt{30}
\end{align}
</math>

and that

:<math>
\mathbf{u}\cdot\mathbf{v}=u_1v_1+u_2v_2+u_3v_3=-1+10-6=3.
</math>

Therefore,

:<math>
\cos(\theta)=\frac{3}{\sqrt{14}\sqrt{30}}=\frac{3}{\sqrt{420}}.
</math>
statement_html: What is \(\cos(\theta)\) where \(\theta\) is the angle between the vectors [1,2,3] and [-1,5,-2]?
statement_latex:
What is $\cos(\theta)$ where $\theta$ is the angle between the vectors
{[}1,2,3{]} and {[}-1,5,-2{]}?
statement_raw: What is <math>\cos(\theta)</math> where <math>\theta</math> is the angle between the vectors [1,2,3] and [-1,5,-2]?
